meanings.definition: Greater in amount, number, or degree.
meanings.sent1: The big cake is more delicious than the small one.
meanings.sent2: She wanted more candy after finishing the first piece.
meanings.sent3: The cat demanded more treats by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for the project was more infectious than anyone else's.
meanings.sent5: The sunburn on his face was more painful than he expected.

meanings.sent1: She wanted to play more after finishing her homework.
meanings.sent2: He decided to study more to improve his grades.
meanings.sent3: The kids asked for more ice cream, even though they had already eaten a lot.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden bloomed more beautifully after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The music became more soothing as the volume decreased.

meanings.definition: To a greater extent or degree.
meanings.sent1: He needs to exercise more to stay healthy.
meanings.sent2: She will practice more to become a better pianist.
meanings.sent3: The students cheered for their team more loudly as they scored a goal.
meanings.sent4: His smile brightened more as he saw her approaching.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed more rapidly after the heavy rainfall.
